maml:description.maml:para: Creates or upgrades the database associated with the connected AppSense product instance.

The Initialize-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceDatabase cmdlet creates or upgrades the database associated with the connected AppSense product instance. The product instance must already be connected to before calling this cmdlet.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
When supplied a friendly name is given to the database connection details that are seen in the SCP. This parameter is ignored if not using v10.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the Configuration user is checked to see if it is a valid SQL login that can be used for configuring the required database.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied the Configuration user will be created as a SQL login on the specified server with the required server roles.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied a prompt will appear if the user is required to acknowledge an upgrade or change to the database.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
When supplied a friendly name is given to the database connection details that are seen in the SCP. This parameter is ignored if not using v10.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
The username to be used when making connections to the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the Configuration user is checked to see if it is a valid SQL login that can be used for configuring the required database.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied the Configuration user will be created as a SQL login on the specified server with the required server roles.

An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.

When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to be used when making connections to the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the service user.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied a prompt will appear if the user is required to acknowledge an upgrade or change to the database.
When supplied the Configuration user is checked to see if it is a valid SQL login that can be used for configuring the required database.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied the Configuration user will be created as a SQL login on the specified server with the required server roles.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied a friendly name is given to the database connection details that are seen in the SCP. This parameter is ignored if not using v10.
Returns $true when the database has been initialised successfully and $false if an error occurred whilst initialising. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will create/update the database associated with the currently connected product instance whilst displaying its progress. The credentials in this example are provided in plain text.

This example will create/update the database associated with the currently connected product instance whilst displaying its progress. The user is prompted to enter credentials that should be used for this cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialises an instance of an AppSense component completely.
The Initialize-AppSenseDesktopNowInstance cmdlet initialises an instance of an AppSense component completely. This cmdlet acts as a bootstrap to multiple cmdlets and will ensure that: -

* All pre-requisites are installed * The product instance is available * Create or upgrade the database for the instance * Create or update the website for the instance * Correct any variances that are detected
The product that should be initialised for the product instance.
The authentication type to be used for the website. Accepted values are Anonymous, Windows.
The name of the website that the application pools should be created in. If not supplied the Default Web Site is assumed.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be initialised. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
The port number that the website should be bound to if it is to be created.
When supplied a friendly name is given to the database connection details that are seen in the SCP. This parameter is ignored if not using v10.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the website will be created if it doesn't exist. When specifying this the WebsitePort parameter should also be specified.
When supplied the Configuration user is checked to see if it is a valid SQL login that can be used for configuring the required database.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied the Configuration user will be created as a SQL login on the specified server with the required server roles.
Using this parameter will mean that the SQL Server SMO libraries are available on the installation server. These are available as standalone packages from the SQL Server Feature Pack.
If you are installing SQL Server Express (available in the AppSense software download) as part of a single server installation then these libraries will be installed as part of that.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The product that should be initialised for the product instance.
The authentication type to be used for the website. Accepted values are Anonymous, Windows.
The name of the website that the application pools should be created in. If not supplied the Default Web Site is assumed.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be initialised. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
The port number that the website should be bound to if it is to be created.

Returns the id of the instance when it has been initialised successfully and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will prompt the user for credentials for the configuration and service accounts. It will then initialise the default instance of the AMC whilst displaying progress.

This example will use the provided plain text credentials for the configuration and service accounts. It will then initialise the "Test" instance of the AMC using a website of the same name as the instance. If this site doesn't exist then it will be created and bound to port 81.

This example will use the provided plain text credentials for the configuration and service accounts. It will then initialise the "Test" instance of the AMC using a website called "TestWebsite". If this site doesn't exist then it will be created and bound to port 81.
This example will use the provided plain text credentials for the configuration and service accounts. It will then initialise the default instance of the EMBI.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the transfer key from the database for the currently connected AMC instance.

The Remove-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet removes the transfer key from the database for the currently connected AMC instance. The transfer key should be removed when all servers have the correct encryption key.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when the transfer key is removed successfully and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to remove the transfer key from the database for the currently connected AMC instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Repairs any variances that are found for the connected AppSense product instance.
The Repair-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceVariance cmdlet repairs any variances that are found for the connected AppSense product instance.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when the variances are repaired and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example repairs any variances for the connected AppSense product instance whilst displaying progress. Plain text credentials are used whilst running the cmdlet.
This example repairs any variances for the connected AppSense product instance whilst displaying progress. The user is prompted for credentials to be used whilst running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Generates the encryption key that is used by the AMC when storing credentials in the database.

The Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceEncryptionKey cmdlet generates the encryption key that is used by the AMC when storing credentials in the database. This encryption key must be the same for all AMC servers in the estate that are connected to this database.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided prompts are displayed to ensure that you do want to retrieve the encryption key onto this server.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
When provided prompts are displayed to ensure that you do want to retrieve the encryption key onto this server.
Returns $true when the encryption key is set successfully and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to store an encryption key in the database for the connected AMC instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Stores the specified transfer key into the database of the currently connected AMC instance.
The Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet stores the specified transfer key into the database of the currently connected AMC instance.
Used to read the encrypted key from the database. You will need to use the same password that was used in the Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Used to read the encrypted key from the database. You will need to use the same password that was used in the Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when the transfer key is set successfully and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to store a transfer key in the database for the connected AMC instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves a stored encryption key from the AMC database and uses it on the local server.
The Sync-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceEncryptionKey cmdlet retrieves a stored encryption key from the AMC database and uses it on the local server.
Used to read the encrypted key from the database. You will need to use the same password that was used in the Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided prompts are displayed to ensure that you do want to retrieve the encryption key onto this server.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Used to read the encrypted key from the database. You will need to use the same password that was used in the Set-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided prompts are displayed to ensure that you do want to retrieve the encryption key onto this server.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when the encryption key is retrieved and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to connect to the database of the AMC instance and retrieve the encryption key using the specified password.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines whether an encryption key is set and if it is valid.
The Test-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceEncryptionKey cmdlet determines whether an encryption key is set and if it is valid.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when there is an encryption key set and $false if an error occurred or no encryption key is set or it is invalid. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to connect to the database of the AMC instance to determine if an encryption key is available and valid.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines whether a transfer key is present in the database or not.
The Test-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceTransferKey cmdlet determines whether or not there is a transfer key present in the database.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when there is a transfer key set and $false if an error occurred or no transfer key is set. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example prompts the user for credentials and then uses those to connect to the database of the AMC instance to determine if a transfer key is available.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines whether or not the database for the currently connected product instance needs creating or upgrading.
The Test-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceDatabaseUpgrade cmdlet determines whether or not the database for the currently connected product instance needs creating or upgrading.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
The username to be used when making connections to the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
The username to be used when making connections to the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to be used when making connections to the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the service user.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
Returns $true when the database needs creating or upgrading and $false if an error occurred or no upgrade is required. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example checks to see whether or not the database needs creating or upgrading for the currently connected product instance. Plain text credentials are used in this scenario and progress is displayed whilst the cmdlet is running.

This example checks to see whether or not the database needs creating or upgrading for the currently connected product instance. the user is prompted for credentials to be used in this scenario and progress is displayed whilst the cmdlet is running.

maml:description.maml:para: Determines if there are any variances that would have been reported when running the SCU.
The Test-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceVariance cmdlet determines if there are any variances that would have been reported when running the SCU.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
An object containing the credentials of configuration user.
Returns $true when there are variances found and $false if an error occurred or no variances were found. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example checks to see if there are any variances for the connected AppSense product instance whilst displaying progress. Plain text credentials are used whilst running the cmdlet.

This example checks to see if there are any variances for the connected AppSense product instance whilst displaying progress. The user is prompted for credentials to be used whilst running the cmdlet.

maml:description.maml:para: Connects to an existing product instance.
The Connect-AppSenseDesktopNowInstance cmdlet connects to an existing product instance.
The product that should be connected to. Accepted values are ManagementCentre, PersonalizationServerOnly, BrowserInterfaceOnly, PersonalizationAndBrowserInterface.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be connected to. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The product that should be connected to. Accepted values are ManagementCentre, PersonalizationServerOnly, BrowserInterfaceOnly, PersonalizationAndBrowserInterface.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be connected to. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $true when the connection is made and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example connects to the Personalization Server default instance.
This example connects to the "TestInstance" Management Server instance.

maml:description.maml:para: Initialises the web site for the currently connected product instance.
The Initialize-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceWebsite cmdlet initialises the web site for the currently connected product instance. This cmdlet can create the web site if it doesn't exist.
The product that should be initialised for the product instance.
The authentication type to be used for the website. Accepted values are Anonymous, Windows.
The name of the website that the application pools should be created in. If not supplied the Default Web Site is assumed.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be initialised. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
The port number that the website should be bound to if it is to be created.
The name of the database server to point to. If the database is to be in a names instance then use the format <servername>\<instancename>.
The name of the database to be created or upgraded.
The username to be used when creating or updating the database. If a domain account is being used then use the format <domain>\<username>.
Plain text password for the configuration user.
An object containing the credentials of service user.
When supplied the website will be created if it doesn't exist. When specifying this the WebsitePort parameter should also be specified.
When supplied the configuration user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When supplied the service user is assumed to be a SQL account.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will initialise the web site for the default instance of the Management Server. The site will be initialise in the "Default Web Site".

maml:description.maml:para: Allows calling cmdlets that have not been implemented as yet or that need to be called against the currently connected product instance when using the module.

The Invoke-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceNativeCommand cmdlet allows calling cmdlets that have not been implemented as yet or that need to be called against the currently connected product instance when using the module.
The name of the cmdlet that is to be executed.
The arguments that are to be passed to the cmdlet specified in the FunctionName parameter.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The name of the cmdlet that is to be executed.
The arguments that are to be passed to the cmdlet specified in the FunctionName parameter.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.

dev:type.maml:name: The return type is dependant upon the value supplied to the FunctionName parameter.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the output from the specified function when successful and $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example will call the "Export-ApsDatabaseScript" cmdlet for the currently connected instance and export the specified script types to "C:\ExportScripts".
This example will execute the "Get-ApsCurrentInstance" against the currently connected product instance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example uses splatting to update the database for the currently connected product instance. It will prompt for the credentials to use.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve the installation path of the given AppSense product instance.
The Get-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceInstallPath cmdlet retrieves the installation path of the given AppSense product instance.
The product that should be initialised for the product instance.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be queried. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The product that should be initialised for the product instance.
The name of the AppSense component instance that is to be queried. If not supplied the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.
If successful the installation path is returned.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the installation path of the AppSense Management Server default instance.
C:\Program Files\AppSense\Management Center\Server\Bin
This example retrieves the installation path of the "Test" instance of AppSense Management Server.
C:\Program Files\AppSense\Management Center\Server (Test)\Bin

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves extended details about the given product instance.
The Get-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceDetails cmdlet retrieves extended details about the given product instance. This cmdlet is only available in v10 and above.
The product to retrieve the instance details for.
The name of the instance to retrieve details for. If this is not provided the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The product to retrieve the instance details for.
The name of the instance to retrieve details for. If this is not provided the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.
The details of the specified instance as per the API documentation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves the details for the default instance of the Management Centre.

WebSite : Management HostName : HostPort : 80 LocalPort : 7751 AuthTypes : {Windows} SupportedAuthTypes : {Anonymous, Windows} DatabaseConnection : AMC DB Connection DatabaseName : AMS-MODULE-DEFAULT DatabaseInstance : DESKTOPNOW\MySQLInstance Status : Started Logging : Disabled Variances : {} BindingInfo : {AppSense.ServerConfiguration.PowerShell.Model.ApsServerBindingDetails} ConfigurationBindingInfo : {AppSense.ServerConfiguration.PowerShell.Model.ApsServerBindingDetails, AppSense.ServerConfiguration.PowerShell.Model.ApsServerBindingDetails} OriginalUpgradeCode : 935bfcca-23d0-4a08-93e4-064025b91d7b InstanceId : 935bfcca-23d0-4a08-93e4-064025b91d7b InstanceName : DEFAULT

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves details about the given product instance.
The Get-AppSenseDesktopNowInstanceProperties cmdlet retrieves details about the given product instance.
The product to retrieve the instance details for.
The name of the instance to retrieve details for. If this is not provided the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
The product to retrieve the instance details for.
The name of the instance to retrieve details for. If this is not provided the default instance is assumed.
When provided the time will also be output to any verbosely written line.
Returns $false if an error occurred. If $false is returned check the $error variable for details.
The details of the specified instance as per the API documentation.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This example retrieves basic details for the default instance of Management Centre.

Name : DEFAULT InstanceId : 935bfcca-23d0-4a08-93e4-064025b91d7b ProductCode : cf765d35-260d-4047-9722-bf211ee78a31 OriginalUpgradeCode : 935bfcca-23d0-4a08-93e4-064025b91d7b OriginalProductCode : cf765d35-260d-4047-9722-bf211ee78a31 Version : 8.7.620.0 InstallPath : C:\Program Files\AppSense\Management Center\Server\Bin\ CmdletPath : C:\Program Files\AppSense\Management Center\Server\Bin\AppSense.ServerConfiguration.PowerShell.dll;C:\Program Files\AppSense\Management Center\Server\Bin\AppSense.ManagementServer.PowerShell.dll ProductName : AppSense Management Server 8.7 SP1 IsDefault : True Status : Unknown DisplayName : AppSense Management Server 8.7 SP1 (DEFAULT)
